div.head: TO THE RIGHT VVORSHIPFVLL and truely Religious, HENRY WALLOPE, Knight; the fat of Earth, and the dew of Heauen.
div.p: Seneca will not haue it denyed, that a good Pylot is skilfull, albeit it be on dry land; his reason is, because being endowed both with contemplatiue and practicke knowledge, so much as may be thought necessary both to make him positiuely, and comparatiuely sufficient for that Art he is onely destitute of opportunity to bewray his iudgement, and ability. My case is iust so: I must sincerely confesse my due respect euer since I was first known vnto you, and haue wanted nothing with the good Pylot, but occasion to shew it; let me this way call the world to witnesse that I honour you.

That which put me vpon this Text, was the request of some of my friends made vnto me, for some reasons best knowne vnto them and me. How I haue answered their expectation, I know not; whatsoeuer this poore
discourse seemes to be, I shall desire you to accept it with the same affection that I bestow it on you; the gift is too light, if it be waighed against your fauours: but I hope you will respect the minde and ability of the giuer, imitating Augustus, who with as ready a hand receiued those few verses presented vnto him by a poore Greeke, as that great Arabian Courser giuen him by Titinius.

If I haue not meddled with any controuersed points (as the words of the Text seeme to promise, and as I presume it was expected) conceiue in charitie that I aimed chiefely at the present profit of my hearers: besides, it had beene somewhat too presumptuous, considering the worth of all those who haue both disputed and written of these things. Howsoeuer, let me say this place of Scripture to be like vnto that leafe which beareth both the Antidote and the Aconiton: for certainly our aduersaries possessed with the spirit of slumber, doe most vilely abuse this Text, and are therefore baned in the same place were others are preserued.
There remaineth nothing, but that I commend you and all yours to God in my prayers, which I will neuer cease to doe, and remaine euer,

closer.signed: Yours humbly at command, M. B.
